str2: If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (lit: I maim, mutilate), I cut short, shorten, abbreviate. From a derivative of the base of kolazo; to dock, i.e. abridge.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To save, heal, preserve, rescue. From a primary sos; to save, i.e. Deliver or protect.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From eklegomai; select; by implication, favorite.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Plural
Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To pick out for myself, choose, elect, select. Middle voice from ek and lego; to select.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (lit: I maim, mutilate), I cut short, shorten, abbreviate. From a derivative of the base of kolazo; to dock, i.e. abridge.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
